div.p: Self-Help Graphics is a non-profit arts center that was established in 1973. During this time the Chicano Movement was still very active which is why some of its principles are reflected within this community-based center. For instance, Self Help Graphics emphasizes the need to be more inclusive of groups across generational and race differences. It promotes a social consciousness of the Latino community by producing art reflective of peoples’ own experiences and realities. Essentially, it works toward achieving a more open space where communal relationships may develop. By way of fine art printmaking and visual art forms, Self Help Graphics is able to encourage and empower Chicano and Latino artists to showcase their unique talents and artistic abilities. At the same time it serves as an asset to the younger and emerging artists by regularly offering exhibits, classes, and workshops.

note.p: Self-Help Graphics is a community-based arts center that empowers Chicanos and Latinos to showcase their culturally rich artistic abilities.
